intro: Anthonotha cladantha, commonly known as the clustered thornweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and cylindrical stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Anthonotha cladantha is often found in shrublands and is valued for its resilience in harsh climates.
